events.name: Couple Problem Solving Techniques
events.description:
Training Objective:
The aim is to manage problems in relationships constructively, ensure mutual understanding between partners, and cause positive effects such as happiness, openness, strength, harmony, and satisfaction in relationships, as well as change and development. To gain problem-solving skills.

Training Content:
Problems experienced in relationships, unresolved issues
Lack of communication
Feeling valued in relationships
Secrets of being a happy couple
Crisis management in relationships
Toxic relationships and ways to escape them
Effective Communication in Marriage
Communication Breakdown Between Spouses
How to Solve Communication Problems in Relationships
Problem Solving with Partner and Marital Harmony
What Couples in Disagreement Should Do
How problems should be solved
Acknowledging the existence of a problem, correctly identifying the problem
Generating alternatives for solutions
How it should be applied
Evaluating the outcome
Training Duration: 3 Sessions, 6 Hours
Training Fee: 750 TL

Certificate to be Awarded at the End of the Training:
Participation Certificate Approved by the Mental Health Association

events.name: Moxo Attention Test Training
events.description:
Training Objective
This training aims to provide information about working methods with individuals who have Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) and to equip professionals with knowledge and skills about administering the MOXO test.

What is MOXO?
The MOXO Attention Test is an online test, administered by professionals, that measures Attention, Timing, Impulsivity, and Hyperactivity performance without involving opinions or feelings.

MOXO has been found to be highly effective in measuring levels of Attention, Timing, Impulsivity, and Hyperactivity performance; however, the test's rapidly increasing popularity is attributed to the unique Distraction System found in MOXO.

To focus on a seemingly simple MOXO task, an individual must ignore visual and auditory distractions in the test, just as they would need to in daily life. This requires active inhibition of distractions, making the test more challenging and advancing its decisive qualities.

MOXO Child Test
The MOXO Child Test is specifically designed for children aged 6-12 and serves as an auxiliary tool for ADHD diagnosis and patient observation processes for professionals. It is a short and online test containing various stimuli and distractors.

A 15-minute online test with age-appropriate stimuli
Various languages audio instructions and a trial session easily understandable by children
A unique set of distractors that allows testing of an individual's performance under different environmental conditions
An up-to-date norm base covering ages 6 and up
A performance graph that measures the change in an individual's performance over time (during the test)
An online interface easily accessible from any computer with internet access using only a keyboard, without any additional devices
Patient information secured with high-level security according to USA-HIPPA privacy laws and regulations

MOXO Adolescent & Adult Test
The MOXO Adolescent&Adult test covers the age range of 13-65 and assists professionals in evaluating the attention profile of patients in ADHD diagnosis and observation processes. The MOXO Adolescent&Adult ADHD Test models the environmental conditions an individual faces in daily life with its unique distraction system.

An 18-minute online test with appropriate stimuli and distractors
A unique set of distractors that allows testing of an individual's performance under different environmental conditions
A regularly updated norm base consisting of a total of 900 individuals from different countries
A performance graph that measures the change in an individual's performance over time (during the test)
An online interface easily accessible from any computer with internet access using only a keyboard, without any additional devices
Patient information secured with high-level security according to USA-HIPPA privacy laws and regulations

Who Can Attend the Training?
The training is intended for Psychologists, Psychiatrists, Psychological Counselors, Special Education Specialists, and senior students of related fields.

Document to be Awarded at the End of Training
A MOXO Practitioner Expert Certificate will be awarded.

Quota
Limited.

Platform Where the Training Will Take Place
Google Meet

Training Fee
2000 TL.

events.name: 15th Psychology Days: Colorful Psychology
events.eventHost: Istanbul Okan University Department of Psychology
events.description:
Everything speaks in its own language;

Even if darkness covers it

It continues in the night, in various colors

On the tree branch, in the wind;

Everything speaks in its own color.

Can Y√ºcel, Green Poem

We are organizing this event for undergraduate psychology students and newly graduated psychology enthusiasts. Our aim is to bring together young individuals at the beginning of their journey with those who have dedicated years to various disciplines of psychology. Thus, we want to connect young psychologists or candidates who are seeking their own path with different role models and create an active interaction environment where emotions, thoughts, and experiences are shared...

Where did the idea of 'Colorful Psychology' come from? Let's explain by quoting from the text I wrote while introducing the Psychology Department on Okan University's Psychology Department website: Imagine for a moment that you want to paint a wall in your house. Needless to say, before obtaining your color, you need to make some preparations to color the wall. First, you must repair and prime the wall. Then, with the right information, you mentally prepare the color, quality, and suitability of the actual coloring you will apply in multiple layers. Undergraduate education in psychology is like this initial stage to achieve the desired outcome and establish a solid foundation. Your color choice occurs as a final step that reflects your desire and goal. Let's continue with our coloring analogy. There are so many colors to choose from that each one can open the doors to a different world for you...

We couldn't cover all the colors in this first meeting. There are many more colors to come. Let's get started. We are waiting for all students. See you soon..

Prof. Dr. Arif Haldun SOYG√úR

events.name: 35 Basic Techniques Used in Psychotherapy
events.description:
Within the scope of the program, regardless of the school they practice, participants will be provided with 35 fundamental techniques from various approaches, essential for their toolkit. These techniques are designed to facilitate swift change in clients, especially when encountering challenges during psychotherapy sessions.

The objective of the program is to impart practical skills in applying a wide array of fundamental techniques functional in therapy and derived from many different schools. Throughout the program, participants will be introduced to the theoretical underpinnings of effective and functional techniques from evidence-based therapeutic schools.

Following this theoretical presentation, participants will be given detailed instructions on how to apply these techniques through case studies, and will have the opportunity to practice these techniques through role-plays. This approach ensures that participants complete the program with both a theoretical understanding and practical experience in applying these key techniques.
